```{r}


# load data set
diabetes <- read.csv("diabetes.csv", header=T)

#Calculating necessary Sample Size
Population_Size <- nrow(diabetes)
MOE <- 0.05
Z <- 1.96
Proportion <- 0.5
Sample_Size <- 
  Proportion*(1-Proportion)/(MOE^2/Z^2+Proportion*(1-Proportion)/Population_Size)
```
Using $n = \frac{p(1-p)}{\frac{\sigma^2}{z^2} + \frac{p(1-p)}{N}}$ results to the necessary
sample size of `r Sample_Size` rounding to 257. 

```{r}
#Selecting the samples

#set seed
set.seed(1738)
#Random sample selection
SRS_Sample <- diabetes[sample(nrow(diabetes), Sample_Size), ]
head(SRS_Sample)

#Stratified sample selection !!!To be decided how to stratify!!!
```
